examples: The susurrus of wind through autumn leaves filled the garden.

definition: Evoking a keen sense of sadness
examples: A poignant moment silenced the room.

definition: Truly what it is said to be
examples: Genuine concern showed in her voice.

definition: Unable to be denied or disputed

examples: The transparent excuse fooled no one.

definition: The design and making of fashionable clothes
Relating to the sense of touch
Able to be touched or felt
examples: Tension was palpable in the room.

definition: In the process of coming into being

examples: The flourishing arts scene attracted visitors.

definition: Having a great deal of money

examples: Her scintillant eyes danced with joy.

definition: Giving out small flashes of light
examples: The glinting sword caught his eye.

definition: Shining faintly with a wavering light

examples: The gleaming trophy was displayed proudly.

definition: Shining with a soft trembling light
examples: Shimmering heat rose from the pavement.

definition: Light emission not caused by heat
examples: The luminescence of the jellyfish amazed divers.

definition: A lustrous rainbow-like play of color
examples: The iridescence of the peacock amazed viewers.

definition: Covered with or resembling a thin film
examples: A filmy haze covered the valley.

Her airy manner put people at ease.

definition: Relating to a nebula or cloud
Of or with respect to the stars
examples: Sidereal time differs from solar time.

definition: So small as to be visible only with a microscope
examples: Microscopic life teemed in the drop.

definition: Impossible to see or clearly distinguish
Not clearly visible or attracting attention
examples: The inconspicuous entrance was hard to find.

definition: Familiar with many countries and cultures

examples: Genteel society gathered at the club.

definition: Characterized by intense feelings of well-being
examples: A euphoric mood spread through the crowd.

definition: Attracted and held the attention of

definition: Aroused the curiosity or interest of

definition: Able to make way into or through

Present or experienced to a severe degree

definition: Having a fine cutting edge or point

definition: Having a ready insight into things

examples: Judicious use of resources was required.

definition: Acting with care for the future
Of or according to the rules of logic

examples: The notable exception proved the rule.

definition: Making marks that cannot be removed
Judged over time to be of highest quality
examples: Classic design never goes out of style.

definition: Satisfying one's conception of what is perfect
